title: Ganesh Chaturthi Festival
subtitle: The Grand Celebration of Lord Ganesha
overview: Ganesh Chaturthi is Maharashtra’s most celebrated festival, honoring Lord Ganesha, the remover of obstacles. The state transforms into a vibrant sea of devotion, music, and color during this 10-day festival.
Public pandals across Mumbai, Pune, and other cities host grand idols of Lord Ganesha, with cultural programs, bhajans, and social events fostering unity and devotion.

highlights.title: Public Pandals
highlights.description: Magnificent idols installed in beautifully decorated pandals attract devotees from across the state.

highlights.title: Visarjan Procession
highlights.description: The immersion of idols in rivers or the sea on Anant Chaturdashi marks the emotional end of the festival.

geography.intro: The festival is celebrated statewide, especially in Mumbai, Pune, and Konkan regions where traditional fervor meets artistic expression.

climate.description: Held during monsoon (August–September), when Maharashtra’s atmosphere is lush and festive.

seasons.text: Rain adds charm to the colorful celebrations.
Pleasant weather ideal for public gatherings.

geography.conclusion: Ganesh Chaturthi symbolizes devotion, art, and unity — making it the soul of Maharashtra’s culture.

activities.title: Aarti & Bhajans
activities.description: Devotees gather twice a day for aarti accompanied by traditional drums and chants.

activities.title: Idol Decoration
activities.description: Local artisans create eco-friendly idols and decorations.
info: Best seen in Pune and Pen workshops.

activities.title: Visarjan Procession
activities.description: Witness grand processions with music and dance during immersion day.
info: Carried out across rivers and seashores.

attractions.title: Lalbaugcha Raja, Mumbai
attractions.description: The most iconic Ganesh idol, visited by millions of devotees.

attractions.title: Dagdusheth Halwai Ganpati, Pune
attractions.description: Known for its grandeur and gold-plated idol, symbolizing Pune’s devotion.

marineLife.intro: Though not related to marine life, the festival’s eco-awareness encourages idol immersion in artificial ponds.

items.title: Eco-friendly Idols
items.description: Promotes sustainable celebration with clay idols and natural colors.

items.title: Environmental Awareness
items.description: Initiatives to protect marine life by avoiding chemical paints.

conclusion: Ganesh Chaturthi blends devotion and sustainability beautifully.
A perfect balance between culture and ecology.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Major stations: Mumbai CST, Pune Junction.
Local trains run frequently to festival areas.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: MSRTC buses connect all major cities.
Traffic restrictions apply during immersion days.

bookingTips.description: Book accommodations early — especially in Mumbai and Pune.
Carry waterproof gear for monsoon photography.
Participate respectfully in aartis and processions.
